content.title: How Do Bees Survive Freezing Temperatures?

items.prompt: What is the best title of the passage?

options.A: Do freezing temperatures completely kill bees?
options.B: How do bees survive freezing temperatures?
options.C: How can humans protect their homes from beehives?
options.D: How do bees produce honey in winter?

items.prompt: What percentage of pollination is contributed by honeybees?
What do bees use the nectar and pollen they have collected for?

options.A: To restore nutrition and protect their hive
options.B: To defend themselves and heat up their hive
options.C: To warm themselves and protect their hive
options.D: To regain nutrition and heat up their hive

items.prompt: What is "emerge" in paragraph (A) closest in meaning to?
According to the passage, freezing temperatures affect the following factors EXCEPT ______.
In paragraph (B), what best paraphrases the sentence "Clustering, however, does not generate enough heat to combat death from freezing"?

options.A: There exist other methods to protect bees from death in freezing temperatures.
options.B: Clustering is one way to produce heat against dropping temperatures.
options.C: Even grouping, the bees will still die if the temperature is low enough.
options.D: Enough heat can be generated if bees are likely to form bigger groups in their hive.

items.prompt: What is the main idea of paragraph (C)?

options.A: Freezing weather helps reduce the number of bees in the hive.
options.B: Bees can regulate their hive population more easily in freezing temperatures.
options.C: There are different roles for bees in the hive.
options.D: The queen bee is responsible for producing more worker bees.

items.prompt: According to the passage, what will be displaced from the hive in cold weather?
The phrase "the colony" in paragraph (D) can refer to ______.
According to the passage, which of the following is true?

options.A: It is noise disturbing the hive on your home's walls.
options.B: Winter is the perfect time for bees to collect the nectar and pollen.
options.C: Bees can withstand the freezing weather only by gathering in the hive.
options.D: Bees may die as they carry thick flower nectar in dropping temperatures.
